intro: Senecio dolichodoryius, commonly known as the long-stemmed senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming during the summer months. Senecio dolichodoryius is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
